intro: Mikania phaeoclados var. typica, commonly known as the creeping morning glory, is a species of flowering plant in the Convolvulaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its rapid growth and trailing habit. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the morning. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are slender and twining. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges, where it can spread aggressively.
